title: Traditions of Edinburgh.
author: Chambers, Robert
snippet: in Leith, the father of seven sons, all of whom attained respectable situations in life : one was the late Mr Samuel Anderson of St Germains, banker. They had been at school with Mr Henry Dundas (afterwards Lord Melville) ; and when he had risen to high office, he called one day on Mr Anderson, and expressed his earnest wish to have the pleasure of dining with his seven school companions, all of whom happened at that time to be at home.
